alert.note: Alert for Furnas; Harlan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 3:25AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Near-Critical Fire Weather Conditions Likely This Afternoon Into Early This Evening... Although a formal Warning is not in effect mainly due to vegetation/grasses not being as conducive to widespread fire growth during the summer as they often are during other times of the year, solidly near-critical fire weather conditions are likely this afternoon and early evening. This will be due to the combination of southerly winds gusting to around 25 MPH, along with very hot temperatures and dry air driving relative humidity values down as low as 15 to 20 percent. As a result, caution is advised this afternoon and early evening if engaging in any activity that could possibly spark a wildfire.
